scripts.say: You see, I'm struggling to come up with good presents for my Royal Navy friends.
(My word, that's a large bag of presents she's got...)
And it takes quite some time to pick out presents for that many people. Unfortunately, time is a luxury we don't have...
That's not an issue. It should hardly take any time to go to the store and purchase things.
It takes you hardly any time?! Do you plan out what to buy before you even leave the dorm?! Please, tell me your secret!
Plan out? Secret? Maybe I didn't make myself clear, but I'm not that selective when it comes to buying presents.
Then how do you find the present that's just right for someone?
You don't need to fuss over finding the right present. They'll probably be happy just to receive a present in the first place, because it's the thought that counts.
Ah, the thought behind it... I see now. It's not about the item itself, but the feelings it represents!
Exactly. Hey... this conversation gave me an idea. You should be Santa this year, Warspite.
Do you have a Christmas costume ready?
If it's the thought that counts, surely a costume wouldn't be necessary?
W-Warspite, you could... use the Christmas costume my sisters and I made, if you'd like...
It's a spare one, so we would be delighted to see it put to use!
I can't turn down an offer like that. Thank you, Cygnet! I feel the thought behind your offer loud and clear!
All right, let us head to the store to buy some presents!
P-please, don't put it that way... You're making it sound weird...
The Royal Navy will surely have an interesting Christmas with Santa Clauspite around. Hahahah!
